document.docAuthor: Xue, Xiao-Feng, Song, Zi-Wei & Hong, Xiao-Yue
document.masterDocTitle: Seven new species of the genus Epitrimerus Nalepa (Acari: Eriophyidae: Phyllocoptinae) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Seven new species of the genus Epitrimerus Nalepa (Acari: Eriophyidae: Phyllocoptinae) from China

heading.emphasis:
Key to species of
Epitrimerus
in China

paragraph.keyLead:
3 Median line on prodorsal shield present
....................................... Epitrimerus amoni
Kuang & Hong, 1989

- Median line on prodorsal shield absent
.................................................... Epitrimerus aceris
Huang, 2001 b

5 Prosternal apodeme present, median line present on prodorsal shield.
Epitrimerus englerus
Huang, 2001
b

- Prosternal apodeme absent, median line absent from prodorsal shield.
Epitrimerus turgidus
Huang, 2001
c

7 Prosternal apodeme absent
........................................................ Epitrimerus irisanus
Huang & Wang, 2004

- Prodorsal shield without granules and short lines
................................... Epitrimerus microcarpae
sp. nov.

9 Prodorsal shield with many short lines, female genital coverflap with eight longitudinal ridges.................
.......................................................................................................................... Epitrimerus argyris
sp. nov.

- Prodorsal shield with many granules, female genital coverflap with 12 longitudinal ridges........................
............................................................................. Epitrimerus pyri
(
Nalepa), 1891
; (
Hong & Zhang, 1996
)

- Female genital coverflap with 12 to 14 longitudinal ridges
....... Epitrimerus piper
Wei, Xie & Chen, 2006

15 Median line present
..................................................... Epitrimerus armeniacae
Kuang, Luo & Wang, 2005

18 Prodorsal shield smooth
............................................. Epitrimerus libocedri
(
Keifer) 1939
; (
Huang, 2001 c
)

25 Female
genital coverflap smooth
........................................... Epitrimerus dimocarpi
Kuang & Hong, 1989

- Female genital coverflap with longitudinal ridges
.......... Epitrimerus ipomoeae
Wei, Feng & Huang, 1999

26 Median line present
................................................... Epitrimerus virginiana
Keifer, 1959
; (
Huang, 2001 c
)
